== Event for the February 2009 GlobalBugJam ==

 {*} What is a "Global Bug Jam"?
It's an opportunity for Local Teams to get together all around the world and concentrate on fixing bugs, meet new people, and just have a good time.

 
 {*} Date: Saturday, February 21, 2009

 {*} Time: Noon - 6PM

 {*} Location:
** <nowiki>[[http://www.rhd.org|Resources for Human Development (RHD)]]</nowiki>, 4700 Wissahickon Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19144
** <nowiki>[[http://ubuntupennsylvania.org/download/DirectionsToRHDCentralOffice.pdf|Site-Specific Directions (pdf)]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://www.alexion.com/rhd-directions|Aerial View w/ notes]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=4700+Wissahickon+Ave,+Philadelphia,+PA+19144&sll=40.232292,-75.639189&sspn=0.004636,0.013797&ie=UTF8&ll=40.026431,-75.161419&spn=0.0186,0.055189&z=14&iwloc=addr|Google Map]]</nowiki>

 {*} Preparation:
** <nowiki>[[http://ubuntupennsylvania.org/download/Ubuntu-US-PA-Bugjam-Handout.odt|Ubuntu US PA BugJam Handout]]</nowiki> (copies will be available at the !BugJam)
** <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HelpingWithBugs|Helping with Bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToTriage|How to Triage]]</nowiki>

Experienced Triagers will be on-site to assist ALL who are interested in learning more about this vital 
part of the Open Source Community.  There is no pressure; the only requirement is to want to learn and 
have fun.
